subject: Re: [junit] Re: Sample code for using JUnit on SOAP-based service-oriented architecture
msgSnippet: ... You should try tinyurl.com. They now have a script you can drag to your browser s bookmark bar, so when you re on a site, you can immediately translate the
messageBody:
Mike Foley wrote:

> Trying to re-post the link to the JUnit for SOA sample code
> <http://http://michael01612.spaces.live.com/blog/cns%212D894EF96C8FC0%21\
> 2059.entry
> <http://http://michael01612.spaces.live.com/blog/cns%212D894EF96C8FC0%212059.entry>>
> in a manner where the link isn't broken.

You should try tinyurl.com. They now have a script you can drag to your
browser's bookmark bar, so when you're on a site, you can immediately
translate the URL into something short and postable. I find the tool
very handy.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
